entry.title: Machine Learning || 5. Types of ML-Reinforcement Learning || Dumb Minds

media:group.media:title: Machine Learning || 5. Types of ML-Reinforcement Learning || Dumb Minds
media:group.media:description: Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reinforcement_learning Transcription: How many of you play computer chess game? How many games will you will win with computer? 10 out of 10 or 5 out of 10 of 1 out of 10, but most of the people like me can win zero games out of 10. How can that possible, I thought humans are the smartest animals on earth, then how does this silicon powered box can overtake human smartness.If you can google ,you wil find lots of chess computers that had beaten the world's best chess players.Lets see what is that? Hello everyone , welcome to Dumb Minds presets Machine Learning for all.I am sukresh and I will be assisting you to learn machine learning with both theory concepts and practical implementation in Python and Java. So far we had disscussed about Supervised learning and Unsupervised learning.Today I am here to tell the most used and my favourite too, that is Reinforcement Learning.Let's start... In Reinforcement learning the core concept is to taking the action that can maximize the reward in a particular situation.It is infact used in many softwares and machines to find the best possible behaviour or path.Let me take an example and explain. The above image shows a robot, a diamond and fire.The goal of the robot is to reach the diamond by avoiding the abstacles that is fire. The robot learns by trying all possible ways and choosing the path which gives him a reward with least hurdles.Each right step will give the robot a reward and each wrong step will subtract a reward from robot.The total reward will be calculated when it reaches it's goal that is diamond. Unlike Supervised Learning where our machine will be trained with the data having answer key, Reinforcement Learning has no answer provided but the agent that is robot here, decides what to do to perform the given task.As the training dataset is absent the machine has to learn from it's experience. And There are two types in Reinforcement learning: 1.Positive:It is to maximize the strength and frequency of the machine. 2.Negative:It is to minimize the negative conditions. That is in Positive we increase the productivity where as in Negative we decrease the loss. As there are many advantages with Reinforcement Learning,it is mostly used in industrial automation and data processing. And coming to chess playing computers, these are actually made with Reinforcement Learning. So that is why they are very good at chess playing.So today moral is to practice makes not only man perfect but also a robot.If you have beaten your computer in chess, let me know who are those aliens in the comment section. If you are impressed with our work, please kindful to give us a like, share and don't forget to subscribe to Dumb Minds. See you in the next session. Dumb Minds is a pack of Knowledge and practice. That gives you legitimate and exact info in a short period of time. entry.title: Machine Learning || 4. Types of ML-Unupervised Learning || Dumb Minds

media:group.media:title: Machine Learning || 4. Types of ML-Unupervised Learning || Dumb Minds
media:group.media:description: Links: Unsupervised-Learning: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unsupervised_learning Supervised vs Unsupervised : https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/supervised-unsupervised-learning/ Transcription: Hello everyone , welcome to Dumb Minds presets Machine Learning for all.I am sukresh and I will be assisting you in learning machine learning with both theory concepts and practical implementation in both Python and Java. In the previous tutorial we had a little introduction to Supervised Learning ,types of Supervised Learning with a few examples and finally we disscussed a few algorithms in Supervised Learning . For today session we'll be getting to know about Unspervised Learning.Let's start without wasting time. And our today agenda is to learn 1.What is Unsupervised Learning and few Examples to illustrate. 2.Where can we be using them. 3.Algorithms used in Unsupervised Learning. Let's start.Unsupervised learning is a type of self-organized learning that hepls in finding previously known patterns in data without labels.Here labels in the sense the outputs.So in Unsupervised Learning we'll be just feeding our machine with inputs only, and it has to identify patterns in the dataset.Let me take an example: | Height | Weight | | 5.9 | 67 | | 6.0 | 75 | | 5.4 | 60 | | 5.8 | 70 | | 5.3 | 58 | | 5.5 | 62 | | 5.2 | 68 | | 6.1 | 80 | | 5.8 | 69 | For this dataset we are feeding the machine with inputs only i.e Height and Weight, and the machine has to find the gender based on the height and weight.So our machine has to find the clusters in the datasets. If we plot our dataset it may look like this.If you can see the plot,the dataset has turned into clusters, one colored as blue and another as purple. But our machine won't know which group is male and which group is female , but it just categorised based on te inputs. After training if we give a testing data to our machine then it will only find which group does it belongs to i.e blue dots or purple dots.This is what called an Unsupervised Learning and the example that I have used is a clustering approach.Unsupervised Learning can also be used in 1.Anamaly detection: See anamalies in the sense they are the rare items which raise suspicions by differing significantly from the majority of the dataset.Let's take an example , there might be a man who might have some abnormal growth like height : 7.4 feet and weight : 148 kg. See this person have rare conditions that makes him seperate from all the remaining group. This is what called anamoly. And using Unsupervised Learning we can find anamolies in the dataset. 2.Artificial Neural Networks: This is where we'll be using both machine learning and deep learning. Here Unsupervised Learning learning can be used to make autoencoders,Deep Belief Networks and lot more. Like that Unsupervised Learning can be used in many ways. This is all about Unsupervised Learning and it's fields of usage.Now lets start to know some basic Algorithms that are used. 1.Heirarchical Clustering 2.k-means algorithms 3.Self-organising map etc.. And we have come to end of the session.This is a brief introduction to Unsupervised Learning.In the description I am providing you the links for Wikipedia pages, check it once. If you still have any doubts ask me in the comment section, So that I can give you solutions or I will show you the way to reach solution. if you like our work , kindful to give us a like. and don't forget to subscribe to Dumb Minds.Thank you and see you in the next session. Dumb Minds is a pack of Knowledge and practice. That gives you legitimate and exact info in a short period of time. entry.title: Machine Learning || 3. Types of ML-Supervised Learning || Dumb Minds

media:group.media:title: Machine Learning || 3. Types of ML-Supervised Learning || Dumb Minds
media:group.media:description: #machine_learning #DumbMinds #Supervised_learning #AI #ML Transcript: Hi, guys welcome to Dumb Minds presents Machine Learning for all. I am Sukresh and I will be assisting you to learn Machine Learning from theory concepts to practical implementation in Python and Java. Lets start our journey. Todays Agenda is to learn 1.Types of all Machine Learning Algorithms 2.Learn the Supervised Learning category of Machine Learning 3.Types of Supervised Learning 4.Examples of Supervised Learning As we have previously stated Machine Learning is an approach of letting machines to learn. Today our session is to learn what are the categories and types of machine learning. The types of machine learning algorithms differ in their approach, the type of data they input and output, and the type of task or problem that they are intended to solve. To be abstract Machine Learning algorithms are divided into three broad categories: 1.Supervised Learning 2.Unsurvised Learning 3.Reinforced Learning The first and foremost category of machine learning is Supervised learning. In this type of approach, training dataset contains both inputs and outputs. So we as we have inputs and outputs, based on them we will make a model that can process the given dataset. So Supervised learning means we provide both inputs and outputs, which indirectly states that we are supervising the work of the machine and after that, we will be checking if it is working fine or not.This is Supervised learning on a nut shell. Supervised Learning is also devided into two types: 1.Classification. 2.Regression. Let's check these types with suitable examples. Have a look at the table given, It is a dataset of a shopping mall that is useful in predicting whether a customer will purchase a particular product under consideration of gender, age and salary. If he buys, the purchased column will be given 1 otherwise given a 0.This type of data learning is Supervised Classification Machine Learning. Because we are classifying the output into duscrete values. So classification algorithms are used when the required outputs are discrete. If we take a real-world example : Gmail classifies mails as spam or not spam. And one more type in supervised is Regression where the output will not be a descrete one, it ranges in a domain.So output can be any value in that range. Let's see the next Table, It is a Meteorological dataset that serves the purpose of predicting wind speed based on different parameters like Temperature, Pressure, Relative Humidity, and Wind Direction. Our output parameter will be Wind Speed. This is just a simple exmaple of how the data set will be for Supervised learning. While training the model, data is usually split in the ratio of 80:20 i.e. 80% as training data and rest as testing data. In training data, we feed input as well as output for the training model. The model learns from training data only, after that we will be testing the accuracy level of our data model by checking the next 20% of data. If we take Algorithms in Supervised Learning: 1.Linear regression 2.Nearest Neighbor 3.Decision Trees 4.Logistic Regression etc.. So this is a brief description of Supervised Learning. If you still have any doubts about this you can post them in the comment section so that I can give your solution or I will show you the way to reach solution. if you like our work, kindful to give us a like. and don't forget to subscribe to Dumb Minds and press the bell icon to get notifications of our latest video.Thank you and see you in the next session. Dumb Minds is a pack of Knowledge and practice. That gives you legitimate and exact info in a short period of time.
